title.narrative: Southeast Europe Regional: Strengthening Trade Unions to Promote Equitable Development

description.narrative: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Solidarity Center provides training on international labor standards and how those standards can be used to protect workers, as well as how unions can improve cooperation and networking with other civil society organizations to protect worker rights. In Serbia, the Solidarity Center works with local trade union partners to investigate worksite compliance with national health and safety standards, as well as educates union leaders and activists on how to advocate for the enforcement of these standards. The Solidarity Center also collaborates with the Central and Eastern European Telecommunications Alliance to provide training and mentoring programs and technical assistance for unions in the telecommunications industries in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia as they organize and recruit new members.
The Solidarity Center supports independent trade unions in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia as they organize and advocate for the protection of worker rights.
